Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery plate; interior slipped; two zones preserved, separated by a band with added red line; lotus and bud frieze outside, perhaps the same in; added red on the lotuses. On the clay ground of the exterior, a 0.5 cm band near bottom break. All glaze fired to light red (7.5 R 6/6).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 26, no. 88 pl. 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.147)
